\section{Quill Rich Text Editor}Quill is a free, \href{https://github.com/quilljs/quill/}{open source} WYSIWYG editor built for the modern web. With its \href{https://quilljs.com/docs/modules/}{modular architecture} and expressive \href{https://quilljs.com/docs/api/}{API}, it is completely customizable to fit any need.\par \subsection{Getting Started}Quill is easy to set up. Here is a simple example to get you started:\par \begin{verbatim}<div id="editor">
  <p>Hello World!</p>
</div>\end{verbatim}\subsection{Formats}Quill supports many formats out of the box:\par \begin{itemize}\item \textbf{Bold} and \textit{italic} text\item \underline{Underlined} and \sout{strikethrough} text\item \texttt{Inline code} and code blocks\item Subscript like H\textsubscript{2}O and superscript like E=mc\textsuperscript{2}\end{itemize}\subsection{Lists}Both ordered and unordered lists are supported:\par \begin{enumerate}\item First ordered item\item Second ordered item\item Third ordered item\end{enumerate}\subsection{Blockquotes}\begin{quote}This is a blockquote. It can contain \textbf{formatted} text and even \href{https://quilljs.com}{links}.\par \end{quote}For more information, visit the \href{https://quilljs.com/docs/}{documentation}.\par \par
